Detailed Description

A 128-bit universally unique identifier (UUID).

This provides an OO wrapper for the uuid_t value defined in the uuid/uuid.h library that allows its inclusion in VRT packets similar to other values. 

    By default the standard UUID library (-luuid) will be used when working with
    UUIDs in the C++ code. Since some platforms do not have this library installed,
    there is a mini UUID library internal to the VRT C++ code. (The internal library
    supports the minimum set of functions required here and is not intended for use
    by external users.) The internal library has two versions: the second version
    supports generation of RFC 4122-compliant UUIDs using gcrypt as a source of
    secure-random numbers; the first version does not depend on gcrypt but does
    not support generation of UUIDs (use the first version only as a last resort).
      Standard UUID library:            setenv INTERNAL_UUID_LIB 0
      Internal UUID library (no gen):   setenv INTERNAL_UUID_LIB 1
      Internal UUID library (random):   setenv INTERNAL_UUID_LIB 2

virtual string vrt::UUID::getFieldName ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the name of the given field.

In 90% of cases the field name will be identical to the name used in the applicable get/set function except without the get/set prefix (e.g. "SourceContext" for "getSourceContext"). It is possible to access the names of all fields via the following: 

    for (int32_t id = 0; id < getFieldCount(); id++) {
      // id is the field ID
      getFieldName(id);
    }

In situations where it is desirable to access all available fields, it is faster to use the field ID as this eliminates any string comparisons.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field name.
Exceptions:
VRTException if the field id is invalid.

Reimplemented from vrt::HasFields.

virtual ValueType vrt::UUID::getFieldType ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the type associated with a given field.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field type (n > 0) or -N if the field is a vector of values where N is the component type of the vector.
